page.title: 03EAST AND WEST WORLINGTON
page.content: There are 29 homes in the hamlets of East and West Worlington.2 of these are farms and 1 is the shop/post office.There is a school,parish hall and 2 churches.Most of the houses are old;built of stone and cob with thatch or slate roofs.There are 8 new dwellings _ 2 houses and 6 bungalows. There has been no building since 1980. There is electricity and mains water but no mains drainage.All properties have septic tanks.6 properties are holiday cottages, 4 are rented long term and 1 is an old persons council bungalow.One house has recently been sold and 3 are for sale.Many people who buy properties stay for less than 5 years and do not involve themselves in community activities.Only three primary age school children live in the hamlets.
